chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Fred L. Phelps was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes:
27 days credit
Consecutive to: Any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: To be taken from up to 25% of prison monies while incarcerated. Remainder to be put on payment plan set up by agent after release.
Must maintain full-time employment after release

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
Absolute sobriety- No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances. May take prescriptions according to doctor's orders, only after approval by agent.

Enroll into and successfully complete a Cognitive/ Behavioral Thinking Program.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the DOC.
Give DNA sample

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: and retroactive to any administrative suspension
